title: Criminal Statute supportive of State v. Huminski, 17-MM-815, Lee County Court & appeals

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

This request concerns your office's litigation in 2 appeals. Huminski v. State, 2d19-1914 & 2d19-1247, Florida 2 DCA, Ashley Moody, esq. Trial court, State v. Huminski, 17-mm-815, Lee County Court. See below,

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law please supply;

1. Any 2017 document that contains a criminal statute relied upon by the State of Florida to achieve plaintiff status and standing in State v. Huminski, 17-MM-815, Lee County Court, and the
2 related appeals litigated by your office (2d19-1247, 2d19-1914). Such a document is supportive of your legitimate participation as Appellee in the 2 appeals. The case was docketed on 6/30/2017, Lee County Court, 17-MM-815, State v. Huminski.

2. Absent a document specified in paragraph 1, please supply any 2017 document statutorily supporting the party status as Plaintiff in State v. Huminski that provided standing concerning the State of Florida in State v. Huminski (a jurisdictional requirement).( AKA the State of Florida's cause of action)  

4. In the absence of any of the above documents, please supply any 2017 document, recording, emails, letters, invoices, financial records, medical records, employment files, police reports,
photographs, text messages, and any other relevant documents/materials concerning the Statutory basis for the State of Florida's participation in State v. Huminski as a criminal plaintiff.

5. This is a follow-up to a prior request that your office has not responded to.   This request is limited to responsive materials from 2017.

(See attached .pdf files)

Related supportive links,
Florida Ethics Commission complaints,

https://www.indybay.org/newsitems/2024/11/25/18871016.php

https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/11/25/merge_notary_thru_mailing.pdf

https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/12/04/amira_final_merge_comp.pdf

https://www.change.org/p/gov-desantis-remove-state-s-attorney-amira-fox-corruption-official-crime

To aid the reply to this document request, the printed case 2D19-1914 can be found at the below links,

https://edca.2dca.org/DcaDocs/2019/1914/2019-1914_Brief_530010_RC09.pdf

https://web.archive.org/web/20201005171650/https://edca.2dca.org/DcaDocs/2019/1914/2019-1914_Brief_530010_RC09.pdf

https://www.indybay.org/uploads/2024/11/25/record_on_appeal_2019-1914_comp64mb.pdf

Related Article and youtube video:

Trump/DeSantis appointees Pam Bondi and Ashley Moody's record of civil rights violations now threatens the nation.
https://www.indybay.org/newsitems/2024/11/25/18871016.php
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zTfxPnIepXM

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

scott huminski

title: Incident Records, Complaints, Audio/Video Evidence, and Disciplinary History Involving Officer Jackman (Badge #64), Officer Kreuscher (Badge #39), and Sergeant Franco

communications.communication:
Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist
April 10, 2025

VIA EMAIL & FOIL PORTAL
Peekskill Police Department
Custodian of Records
2 Nelson Avenue
Peekskill, NY 10566
Email: FOIL@cityofpeekskill.com

DISCLAIMER:
This request is submitted under the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), Article 6 of the Public Officers Law. All communications regarding this request may be shared publicly as part of a journalistic transparency initiative.

FREEDOM OF INFORMATION LAW REQUEST – Incident Records, Complaints, Audio/Video Evidence, and Disciplinary History Involving Officer Jackman (Badge #64), Officer Kreuscher (Badge #39), and Sergeant Franco

Dear FOIL Officer,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law, Article 6), I, Jordan Lassiter, hereby request access to the following records relating to the conduct, internal oversight, complaint history, audiovisual documentation, and communications involving Officer Jackman (Badge #64), Officer Kreuscher (Badge #39), and Sergeant Franco of the Peekskill Police Department. This request is prompted by a specific incident involving these officers that occurred on or around December 4, 2024, and includes broader concerns regarding professional conduct.

In accordance with New York Public Officers Law § 84-90, and the prevailing interpretation of FOIL in relevant court decisions including Matter of Gould v. New York City Police Dept., 89 N.Y.2d 267 (1996), and Mulgrew v. Board of Educ. of City Sch. Dist. of City of N.Y., 87 A.D.3d 506 (1st Dept. 2011), the following records are requested:

Incident-Specific Records for December 4, 2024:
a. All body-worn camera footage, dash camera footage, surveillance video, or third-party video recordings involving or captured by Officer Jackman, Officer Kreuscher, and Sergeant Franco during the incident on December 4, 2024. Please indicate whether each device was activated, functional, and in compliance with departmental policy. (Gould, 89 N.Y.2d at 276, confirming public access to factual materials and recordings).
b. Any 911 audio recordings, CAD reports, dispatcher logs, or transcripts related to the December 4, 2024 incident. (Daily Gazette Co. v. City of Schenectady, 93 N.Y.2d 145 (1999), requiring disclosure of factual components of police records).
c. Any internal reports, use-of-force forms, narrative reports, affidavits, complaints, or supplemental documentation created in relation to the December 4, 2024 incident. (LaRocca v. Bd. of Educ. of City of Niagara Falls, 220 A.D.2d 1000 (4th Dept. 1995)).
d. Any text messages, emails, or other communications between officers or supervisors related to the incident, including informal channels (e.g., personal devices used in official capacity). (Matter of Tuck-It-Away Assoc., L.P. v. Empire State Dev. Corp., 54 A.D.3d 154 (1st Dept. 2008)).
e. Any disciplinary proceedings, administrative investigations, citizen or internal complaints, memos, command reviews, or findings related to the conduct of Officer Jackman, Officer Kreuscher, or Sergeant Franco during or in response to this incident. (Matter of New York Civ. Liberties Union v. New York City Police Dept., 32 N.Y.3d 556 (2018)).
f. Records indicating whether Officer Jackman failed to activate his body-worn camera, and any review of this action for policy violation or misconduct. (Matter of Prisoners' Legal Servs. of N.Y. v. New York State Dept. of Corr. & Community Supervision, 73 N.Y.S.3d 651 (3d Dept. 2018)).
g. Any complaints or statements alleging Officer Jackman used profane, disrespectful, or demeaning language toward citizens while in uniform during this incident, including any written or recorded civilian affidavits or statements. (Matter of Luongo v. Records Access Officer, Civilian Complaint Review Bd., 150 A.D.3d 13 (1st Dept. 2017)).

Officer Jackman (Badge #64):
a. A comprehensive list and summary of all civilian or internal complaints filed against Officer Jackman, whether sustained or not, including the nature of the allegations, complaint dates, and disciplinary outcomes. (Matter of New York Times Co. v. City of N.Y. Police Dept., 179 A.D.3d 556 (1st Dept. 2020)).
b. All disciplinary actions, counseling records, internal memos, and hearing transcripts involving Officer Jackman. (Gould, 89 N.Y.2d at 276).
c. Any video, audio, written testimony, or affidavits submitted in relation to previous disciplinary proceedings. (Luongo, 150 A.D.3d at 20).

Officer Kreuscher (Badge #39):
a. A summary of all civilian or internal complaints filed against Officer Kreuscher, including the nature of the allegations, incident dates, and outcomes. (Matter of Hearst Corp. v. State of N.Y. Police, 109 A.D.3d 32 (3d Dept. 2013)).
b. Any disciplinary actions, official reprimands, or findings of misconduct involving Officer Kreuscher. (Matter of Karlin v. McMahon, 96 N.Y.2d 842 (2001)).
c. Any body-worn camera footage or dash camera recordings from other incidents that were the subject of misconduct complaints involving Officer Kreuscher. (Matter of Daily Gazette Co.).

Sergeant Franco:
a. All civilian or internal complaints filed against Sergeant Franco, including allegations of supervisory misconduct, retaliation, dereliction of duty, or discriminatory behavior. (Matter of Police Benevolent Assn. of N.Y. State Troopers, Inc. v. State of N.Y., 11 N.Y.3d 96 (2008)).
b. All disciplinary records, findings, or hearings involving Sergeant Franco, including reprimands, suspensions, demotions, or administrative hearing documentation. (Gould, 89 N.Y.2d at 276).
c. All body-worn camera, dashcam, surveillance, or audio recordings involving Sergeant Franco during the December 4, 2024 incident or any incident tied to filed complaints. (Daily Gazette, 93 N.Y.2d at 151).

FORMAT & PRESERVATION
Please provide all records in electronic format (PDF, MP4, MP3, etc.) with original metadata intact. Video should include time stamps and original audio. Redactions should be minimized, and any withheld information must be justified in writing citing specific FOIL exemptions, accompanied by a Vaughn-type index.

FEE WAIVER REQUEST
As a credentialed journalist and public transparency advocate, I request a waiver of all associated fees. Disclosure of this information is in the public interest and will significantly contribute to a broader understanding of Peekskill Police Department operations and oversight. If anticipated fees exceed $50, please notify me before proceeding. (Matter of Farbman & Sons v. N.Y. City Health & Hosps. Corp., 62 N.Y.2d 75 (1984)).

RECORD PRESERVATION
Please preserve all responsive records, including electronic communications, audio/video evidence, and paper documentation, until this request is fully processed, including the exhaustion of all appeals and legal remedies.

CONCLUSION
This request supports transparency and accountability in law enforcement practices. I request acknowledgment of receipt within five business days and a full response within the statutory deadline. Please include a tracking number or reference ID in your reply.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Investigative Journalist
jordan@lassiter.eu

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All unedited body-worn camera / bodycam recordings related to the following law enforcement critical incident:

Incident Date: August 8, 2024
Location: Glennonville, MO
Victim Name: Dennis Gerard Prenger

I am specifically requesting the unedited body-worn camera recordings captured by all officers present for the full duration of the incident, including audio recordings associated with the footage. In addition, we request that the name of the victim be released as well.

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Massachusetts AG EO 14190
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any communication, guidance documents, reports, memos or other records regarding the U.S. Attorney General coordinating with the Massachusetts Attorney General to comply with executive order 14190 ("Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling") by enforcing the law and filing appropriate actions against K-12 teachers and school officials who violate the law by:
(i) sexually exploiting minors;
(ii) unlawfully practicing medicine by offering diagnoses and treatment without the requisite license; or
(iii) otherwise unlawfully facilitating the social transition of a minor student.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association

communications.subject: RE: Maine Freedom of Access Act Request: Maine AG EO 14190
communications.communication:
I am the public access officer for the Office of Attorney General.  This email is to acknowledge your Freedom of Access Act request below.  Please note that your request may be denied in part or in whole to the extent responsive records are confidential by statute, within the scope of a privilege against discovery or use as evidence, or otherwise outside the definition of “public records” in 1 M.R.S. §402(3)<https://legislature.maine.gov/statutes/1/title1sec402.html>.

I am consulting with individuals in our office who may have records responsive to your request.  Either myself or someone with subject-matter knowledge relevant to your request will be in touch shortly with further information, including a time and cost estimate if necessary.

General information about the Freedom of Access Act may be found here<https://www.maine.gov/foaa/faq/index.shtml>.

Thank you,
Jon

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Arizona AG EO 14190
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any communication, guidance documents, reports, memos or other records regarding the U.S. Attorney General coordinating with the Arizona Attorney General to comply with executive order 14190 ("Ending Radical Indoctrination in K-12 Schooling") by enforcing the law and filing appropriate actions against K-12 teachers and school officials who violate the law by:
(i) sexually exploiting minors;
(ii) unlawfully practicing medicine by offering diagnoses and treatment without the requisite license; or
(iii) otherwise unlawfully facilitating the social transition of a minor student.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

Trans Journalists Association

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: CIA support for 2025 film "The Amateur"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All documents pertaining to collaboration between the Central Intelligence Agency and the production of the 2025 feature film "The Amateur," directed by James Hawes. Such documents may include but should not be not limited to: script notes; production assistance agreements; photographs; and all records of communications between employees of the CIA and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "The Amateur," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation as well as the editor-in-chief and a contributor to a research magazine published by said foundation titled "Cultural Engineering Studies." These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

If that status is "On Hold", please review the email you received and provide the requested information. If you did not receive an email, please contact the FOIA Requester Service Center via email at FOIAStatus@state.gov. (mailto:FOIAStatus@state.gov) 
If that status is "Closed" or "Documents Delivered", then the Department's response will be emailed or mailed (via US Postal Service). Regards, 
U.S. Department of State
